trans-unit.source: Installing the WDK 8.1 Build Environment in a Lab
trans-unit.target: Installing the WDK 8.1 Build Environment in a Lab

trans-unit.source: The Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 provides a feature that enables you to copy components of Visual Studio and the WDK to a new location and then launch the build environment from the command line.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 provides a feature that enables you to copy components of Visual Studio and the WDK to a new location and then launch the build environment from the command line.

trans-unit.source: From here you can build Windows drivers without having to run the Visual Studio or WDK installation programs.
trans-unit.target: From here you can build Windows drivers without having to run the Visual Studio or WDK installation programs.

trans-unit.source: You might find this feature useful if you need to integrate the WDK with your build process, or if you want to distribute the build process in a lab or test environment.
trans-unit.target: You might find this feature useful if you need to integrate the WDK with your build process, or if you want to distribute the build process in a lab or test environment.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You can only use this feature for building drivers and applications that use C and C++.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You can only use this feature for building drivers and applications that use C and C++.

trans-unit.source: This feature cannot be used for managed code or Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: This feature cannot be used for managed code or Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: Download the Visual Studio and WDK and SDK setup files
trans-unit.target: Download the Visual Studio and WDK and SDK setup files

trans-unit.source: To run the set up script that enables this feature, you need to provide the paths to the Visual Studio and WDK setup files.
trans-unit.target: To run the set up script that enables this feature, you need to provide the paths to the Visual Studio and WDK setup files.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to save these files (rather than install them).
trans-unit.target: Be sure to save these files (rather than install them).

trans-unit.source: Download [Visual Studio Professional 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=316548) or [Visual Studio Ultimate 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=316520).
trans-unit.target: Download [Visual Studio Professional 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=316548) or [Visual Studio Ultimate 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=316520).

trans-unit.source: Download the Product Layout (for example, vs\_ultimate\_download.exe ).
trans-unit.target: Download the Product Layout (for example, vs\_ultimate\_download.exe ).

trans-unit.source: When you are asked if you want to run or save vs\_ultimate\_download.exe, click **Run** and then select the download option and specify the download path as **C:\\VSSetup** (this makes the later steps easier).
trans-unit.target: When you are asked if you want to run or save vs\_ultimate\_download.exe, click **Run** and then select the download option and specify the download path as **C:\\VSSetup** (this makes the later steps easier).

trans-unit.source: Click **Download** to download and install a local copy of the DVD layout on the computer.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download** to download and install a local copy of the DVD layout on the computer.

trans-unit.source: Download the standalone [SDK](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=323507).
trans-unit.target: Download the standalone [SDK](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=323507).

trans-unit.source: When you are asked if you want to run or save sdksetup.exe, click **Run** and then specify the download location as **C:\\Kits\\SDK**.
trans-unit.target: When you are asked if you want to run or save sdksetup.exe, click **Run** and then specify the download location as **C:\\Kits\\SDK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** and follow the instructions to download the standalone SDK.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** and follow the instructions to download the standalone SDK.

trans-unit.source: Download the [WDK 8.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=317353).
trans-unit.target: Download the [WDK 8.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=317353).

trans-unit.source: When you are asked if you want to run or save wdksetup.exe, click **Run** and then specify the download location as **C:\\Kits\\WDK**.
trans-unit.target: When you are asked if you want to run or save wdksetup.exe, click **Run** and then specify the download location as **C:\\Kits\\WDK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** and follow the instructions to download the WDK.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** and follow the instructions to download the WDK.

trans-unit.source: If you have already installed the WDK on the computer, the web installation program will tell you that the features installed on the computer are up-to-date.
trans-unit.target: If you have already installed the WDK on the computer, the web installation program will tell you that the features installed on the computer are up-to-date.

trans-unit.source: To download the WDK setup files so that you can deploy the build environment, click **Next** and specify the **C:\\Kits\\WDK** path.
trans-unit.target: To download the WDK setup files so that you can deploy the build environment, click **Next** and specify the **C:\\Kits\\WDK** path.

trans-unit.source: 2. Download the BuildLabSupport files
trans-unit.target: 2. Download the BuildLabSupport files

trans-unit.source: To be able install the WDK build environment on computers in a lab, you need to first download the build lab support files on your computer.
trans-unit.target: To be able install the WDK build environment on computers in a lab, you need to first download the build lab support files on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Download [BuildLabSupportfiles.zip](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=321805).
trans-unit.target: Download [BuildLabSupportfiles.zip](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=321805).

trans-unit.source: Extract the contents of the compressed file to your computer.
trans-unit.target: Extract the contents of the compressed file to your computer.

trans-unit.source: The extracted files include the BuildLabSupport directory and include the setup files and utilities you need.
trans-unit.target: The extracted files include the BuildLabSupport directory and include the setup files and utilities you need.

trans-unit.source: 3. Install the WDK 8.1 build environment
trans-unit.target: 3. Install the WDK 8.1 build environment

trans-unit.source: The build lab support files include the **setup.ps1** PowerShell command file, which extracts the needed Visual Studio and WDK components and copies them to a target directory (folder).
trans-unit.target: The build lab support files include the **setup.ps1** PowerShell command file, which extracts the needed Visual Studio and WDK components and copies them to a target directory (folder).

trans-unit.source: You can then copy this directory to another location, from which you can build projects in a Visual Studio command-line interface (CLI) development environment.
trans-unit.target: You can then copy this directory to another location, from which you can build projects in a Visual Studio command-line interface (CLI) development environment.

trans-unit.source: Open a Command Prompt window with elevated privileges (**Run as administrator**) and go to the directory where you extracted build lab support files.
trans-unit.target: Open a Command Prompt window with elevated privileges (**Run as administrator**) and go to the directory where you extracted build lab support files.

trans-unit.source: The PowerShell command script **setup.ps1** is in the <*root*>\\BuildLabSupport directory.
trans-unit.target: The PowerShell command script **setup.ps1** is in the <*root*>\\BuildLabSupport directory.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for the PowerShell command is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The syntax for the PowerShell command is as follows:

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: The *<VSInstallerFilePath>* is the path to the Visual Studio installation program (for example, Vs\_ultimate.exe) and directory that contains the product layout.
trans-unit.target: The *<VSInstallerFilePath>* is the path to the Visual Studio installation program (for example, Vs\_ultimate.exe) and directory that contains the product layout.

trans-unit.source: The *<KitInstallersPath>* is the path to the WDK and SDK setup files.
trans-unit.target: The *<KitInstallersPath>* is the path to the WDK and SDK setup files.

trans-unit.source: The *<Target Directory>* is the target directory for the extracted content.
trans-unit.target: The *<Target Directory>* is the target directory for the extracted content.

trans-unit.source: The *<LogFilePath>* is the target destination for the log file.
trans-unit.target: The *<LogFilePath>* is the target destination for the log file.

trans-unit.source: *<Filename.xml>* is the name of the CatalogFile, which contains a list of Microsoft Windows installation files (MSI) to expand as part of the installation.
trans-unit.target: *<Filename.xml>* is the name of the CatalogFile, which contains a list of Microsoft Windows installation files (MSI) to expand as part of the installation.

trans-unit.source: The name of the file is files.xml.
trans-unit.target: The name of the file is files.xml.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following command runs the script from BuildLabSupport directory and installs the build environment in C:\\BuildLabInstall directory.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following command runs the script from BuildLabSupport directory and installs the build environment in C:\\BuildLabInstall directory.

trans-unit.source: 4. Build Windows driver projects and solutions
trans-unit.target: 4. Build Windows driver projects and solutions

trans-unit.source: Using the build environment command script
trans-unit.target: Using the build environment command script

trans-unit.source: Open a Command Prompt window.
trans-unit.target: Open a Command Prompt window.

trans-unit.source: Locate the LaunchBuildEnv.cmd file located in the target directory (for example, C:\\BuildLabInstall).
trans-unit.target: Locate the LaunchBuildEnv.cmd file located in the target directory (for example, C:\\BuildLabInstall).

trans-unit.source: Launch the build environment by running **LaunchBuildEnv.cmd**.
trans-unit.target: Launch the build environment by running **LaunchBuildEnv.cmd**.

trans-unit.source: Use MSBuild commands to build your driver projects and solutions.
trans-unit.target: Use MSBuild commands to build your driver projects and solutions.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: Building a Driver

trans-unit.target: MSBuild
